intro: Trigonella isthmocarpa, commonly known as the Isthmus fenugreek, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces pods that contain several seeds, which are often used in traditional medicine. Trigonella isthmocarpa is typically found in moist, calcareous soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological and agricultural contexts.
